ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned a lot regarding Next gen sequencing through my project and about HIV-1
I am developing my research skills in the lab and my role as a lab member.
Needed for thesis.
Learned about grant proposals and learned a lot from the lab itself, in lab meeting, with mentor, etc.
Strengthened my existing knowledge regarding my research. Learned how to write a grant!
I obtained fundamental laboratory wet lab skills as they relate to biological research in MCDB.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Release the rubrics/instructions for the assignments earlier!!!!!!!!
More instruction and communication from the professors. Never once received any communication about the course, a single email would have been nice.
More communication and clear expectations.
I think a little more guidance or clarification on what is due or what needs to be turned in would be great since the class does not meet regularly.
Needed for thesis.

This course offers very little guidance. Since it is senior thesis research, I expected to be quite independent. However, this course would benefit from reminders, check-ins, etc. to make sure that you are on track for your thesis requirements.

It would be extremely helpful to have a meeting for this course at the beginning of the semester to talk about expectations and requirements. It would also be good to have at least one check in to ensure that requirements are being met, etc. although the email correspondence over the grant proposal was helpful.
Too independent
More guidance from the course instructors could be helpful, such as templates or instruction on what goes in each section of the research proposal and grant proposal.

Strengths: manageable workload, in-lab working hour flexibility, research independence.
Weaknesses: Lack of guidance for writing assignments, inability to connect with other MCDB students during the semester.
I think that the professor could improve in their communication skills.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: You have to take it for MCDB thesis but I would recommend 485 specifically as it is valuable to be in the lab.
Needed for thesis.
You probably have to take this. Mentor matters more than anything-- choose someone you like working with and do some research on the faculty mentors.
Yes MCDB department is wonderful with great ongoing research
Yes, as it is required to fulfill the senior thesis component for the MCDB major.
